```py
  - defaults
dependencies:
  - python=3.8
  - pandas>=1.5
```

```py
$ conda env create -n env
$ conda activate env

$ conda list
...
```

```py
$ source venv/bin/activate
```

```py
# pyproject.toml

[tool.poetry.dependencies]
python = "^3.8"
pandas = "^1.5"
```

```py
# poetry.lock
...
[[package]]
name = "pandas"
version = "1.5.3"
description = "Powerful data structures for data analysis, time series, and statistics"
category = "main"
optional = false
python-versions = ">=3.8"

[package.dependencies]
numpy = [
    {version = ">=1.20.3", markers = "python_version < \"3.10\""},
    {version = ">=1.21.0", markers = "python_version >= \"3.10\""},
    {version = ">=1.23.2", markers = "python_version >= \"3.11\""},
]
python-dateutil = ">=2.8.2"
pytz = ">=2020.1"
tzdata = ">=2022.1"
...
```

```py
# environment.yml
name: test-conda
channels:
  - defaults
dependencies:
  # Production packages
  - numpy
  - pandas
```

```py
# environment-dev.yml
name: test-conda-dev
channels:
  - defaults
dependencies:
  # Production packages
  - numpy
  - pandas
  # Development packages
  - pytest
  - pre-commit
```

```py
# requirements.txt
numpy 
pandas
```

```py
-r requirements.txt
pytest
pre-commit
```

```py
# Install prod
$ pip install -r requirements.txt

# Install both dev and prod
$ pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
```

```py
$ poetry add numpy pandas
$ poetry add --group dev pytest pre-commit
```

```py
# pyproject.toml
[tool.poetry.dependencies]
python = "^3.8"
pandas = "^2.0"
numpy = "^1.24.3"

[tool.poetry.group.dev.dependencies]
pytest = "^7.3.2"
pre-commit = "^3.3.2"
```

```py
$ poetry install --only main
```

```py
$ poetry add 'seaborn==0.12.2'
$ poetry add 'matplotlib<3.1' 

Because poetry shell depends on seaborn (0.12.2) which depends on matplotlib (>=3.1,<3.6.1 || >3.6.1), matplotlib is required.
So, because poetry shell depends on matplotlib (<3.1), version solving failed.
```

```py
poetry add 'seaborn<=0.12.2'  'matplotlib<3.1'
```
